column4: what program can I use to look at the beginning of a binary file?
I tried opening it in Kate (32MB) and it crashed my system
yeah I had to go to tty1 (which took forever) and kill kate and virtuoso-t whatever that is
maybe, you can use a generic binary viewer and pipe that to head?
try od (octal dump), or x(x)d to perform a hex-dump
great! I will try it now
xd is not in the Ubuntu distro, but od is...
yes, what did you expect, did you want ascii chars?
any idea what the 172340000 value is about?
I'm just trying to interpret the output
not the foggiest, especially since you did not tell me what kind of file it is.
my goal here is to see if dd is succeeding in writing to NAND storage of a USB drive
this is a binary dump of the usb drive (unformatted)
private chat? This is a bit offtopic.
sure -- i am just trying to use ubuntu to accomplish a thing
